intro: Pentameris californica, commonly known as the California pentameris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent when crushed.
